Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the novel coronavirus was man-made without sufficient evidence or scientific support.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or scientific support to substantiate the assertion that the novel coronavirus was man-made.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim ignores alternative explanations supported by scientific research, such as natural selection in an animal host or natural selection in humans after the virus spread from animals.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the findings of leading experts and scientific research that indicate the genetic structure of the virus does not indicate it was altered or created in a lab.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the possibility of the virus being man-made by presenting it as a conspiracy theory rather than relying on scientific evidence.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement bias in the provided claim.
Falters at times: There is no evidence of the claim faltering at times bias in the provided claim.
